title: Apple crumble
description: This recipe is an all-time favourite of those hankering after the ultimate quick and easy dessert. Serve with nostalgia.

For the crumble: 300g/10½oz plain flour, sieved pinch of salt
200g/7oz unsalted butter, cubed at room temperature
For the filling: 450g/1lb apples, peeled, cored and cut into 1cm/½in pieces

steps: Place the flour and sugar in a large bowl and mix well. Taking a few cubes of butter at a time rub into the flour mixture. Keep rubbing until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs.
Place the fruit in a large bowl and sprinkle over the sugar, flour and cinnamon. Stir well being careful not to break up the fruit.
Butter a 24cm/9in ovenproof dish. Spoon the fruit mixture into the bottom, then sprinkle the crumble mixture on top.
Bake in the oven for 40-45 minutes until the crumble is browned and the fruit mixture bubbling.
Serve with thick cream or custard.
